Description: Fragment of a clay seal-impression made of fine Nile clay that was burnt and now is completely black in colour. The object was hardened after excavation and shows a shiny surface. On the rear on one side three coils of basketry, on a second side another row of basketry, suggesting that the piece was attached between the lid and the wall of a basket. The front is flat and shows one complete impression of an oval scarab-like seal with many finger impressions around it. The seal itself is relatively roughly cut and shows a winged scarab underneath a sun disc.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 25)
